definitions.definition: To pillage , take or destroy all the goods of, by force (as in war); to raid , sack .
examples: The mercenaries plundered the small town.
The shopkeeper was plundered of his possessions by the burglar.
The mercenaries plundered all the goods they found.

definitions.definition: To take by force or wrongfully; to commit robbery or looting , to raid .
examples: “Now to plunder , mateys!” screamed a buccaneer, to cries of “Arrgh!” and “Aye!” all around.

definitions.definition: To make extensive (over)use of, as if by plundering ; to use or use up wrongfully.
examples: The miners plundered the jungle for its diamonds till it became a muddy waste.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To pillage , take or destroy all the goods of, by force (as in war); to raid , sack .
secondary_definitions: ( intransitive ) To take by force or wrongfully; to commit robbery or looting , to raid .
( transitive ) To make extensive (over)use of, as if by plundering ; to use or use up wrongfully.
